The Nationalist March in Warsaw, Poland, took place this Sunday with thousands of people protesting. Marches took place in cities around the country, including Bialystok, Lublin, and Krakow, but the largest number and widespread attention occurred in the capital, Warsaw. Polish nationalists held their annual march on November 11th celebrating Poland's Independence Day. According to reports on social media, groups chanted slogans of white supremacy and promoted antisemitism by calling for a "Jew free Poland". This has sparked particular concern in the country both because of its historical significance and because of Poland's WWII history. The Polish government claims that the march is not officially supported by the Polish religion.
